conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically with patient consent, while User Story B mandates continuous data collection with strict privacy controls managed by the developer, potentially forbidding automatic monitoring without explicit continuous consent. This creates a conflict where one requires operation O under condition C, and the other forbids operation O under any circumstance.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically with patient consent, so I can maintain clinical oversight respectfully.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to require monitoring cognitive game progress with explicit, continuous patient consent respecting privacy restrictions, aligning with User Story B's strict privacy controls, which remain unchanged.
newUserStoryASummary: I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress only with explicit continuous patient consent, so clinical oversight respects privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires offline access to patient health data when permitted by privacy settings, while User Story B demands continuous data collection with strict privacy control, implying no offline or uncontrolled access; the latter forbids the operation that the former mandates under certain conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient health data offline when permitted by privacy settings, so I can monitor patients responsibly.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
resolutionDescription: User Story A is restricted to offline access only when explicitly permitted under strict privacy settings, while User Story B clarifies continuous data collection with enforced privacy controls and excludes offline access without permission, resolving the forbid-stop conflict by clearly delineating allowed offline use.
newUserStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want offline access to patient data only when privacy settings explicitly allow, so I can monitor patients responsibly.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want continuous data collection with strict privacy controls, excluding offline access without permission, to ensure data security.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual selection to view only essential health data to protect privacy, effectively forbidding full data visibility by caregivers, while User Story B mandates continuous collection of all user data for strict privacy control and system optimization, creating a conflict between selective viewing and continuous full data collection.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually select and view only essential health data on my dashboard to protect privacy and prevent overload.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to clarify manual selection of essential health data for viewing by caregivers, while User Story B remains to continuously collect all user data with strict privacy controls, balancing selective viewing and data collection.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to manually select essential health data to view, ensuring privacy and avoiding information overload.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing to enforce strict privacy and optimize reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires sending video call requests that always respect patient privacy and autonomy, implying constraints on data sharing, while User Story B calls for continuous collection of all user data with developer-controlled sharing to enforce strict privacy and optimize reminders. The strict continuous collection conflicts with the caregiver's requirement for respecting privacy and autonomy, making it impossible to satisfy both simultaneously.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to send video call requests that always respect patients' privacy and autonomy during well-being checks.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story B is updated to collect only necessary user data with explicit consent and strict anonymization to respect privacy, while User Story A remains unchanged to ensure video call requests respect patient privacy and autonomy.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to send video call requests that always respect patients' privacy and autonomy during well-being checks.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to collect necessary user data with explicit consent and anonymized sharing to enforce privacy and optimize reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual review with controlled offline access to maintain privacy, effectively limiting continuous data access, whereas User Story B demands continuous data collection with full control over sharing to enforce strict privacy. These opposing expectations about data access and collection under the same conditions create a Start-Forbid conflict.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually review clients' health data irregularities with controlled offline access, so that I maintain privacy and provide timely support.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow manual review with periodic controlled data access instead of strictly offline, aligning with continuous collection in User Story B while preserving privacy safeguards.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to review clients' health data periodically with controlled access, so that I maintain privacy and provide timely support.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires controlling patient data privacy while receiving detailed alerts, implying selective data sharing, whereas User Story B mandates continuous data collection with full control over sharing to enforce strict privacy, which can forbid the selective privacy control expected by caregivers. Thus, one requires operation under condition C (controlled alerts with privacy), while the other forbids partial data sharing under any condition.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control patient data privacy while receiving detailed alerts, ensuring responsive and secure care.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance continuous data collection with strict privacy controls and selective alert sharing, clarifying conditions under which privacy controls apply to maintain caregiver responsiveness while enforcing data privacy.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive detailed alerts with controlled patient data privacy, ensuring secure and responsive care under consented sharing conditions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect user data while enforcing strict privacy controls and configurable sharing settings, so proactive reminders respect user consent.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires controlling and restricting discussion of sensitive health data to ensure privacy, while User Story B requires continuous collection of all user data for processing, which may conflict with the strict forbiddance of some data sharing or discussion under any circumstances.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to control when sensitive health information is discussed, ensuring privacy and maintaining trust.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to specify privacy controls restricting sensitive health data discussion only under specific conditions, allowing User Story B's continuous data collection with consent and privacy enforcement.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to control sensitive health data discussions under defined conditions, so that user privacy and trust are maintained.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual control to disable game notifications to protect privacy, while User Story B requires continuous data collection with full control over sharing, implying uninterrupted data flow; these impose contradictory constraints on data sharing operations.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually control game notifications, so I can protect clients' privacy and prevent overwhelming them.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
resolutionDescription: Modified user stories to balance manual control of notifications for privacy with continuous data collection under strict sharing controls, enabling configurable notification and data flow management.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually control game notifications, so I can protect clients' privacy while allowing essential data collection.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect user data with configurable sharing controls, so I can enforce privacy and optimize proactive reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids or restricts data sharing per client to protect privacy, while User Story B mandates continuous data collection and full control for sharing to enforce strict privacy, creating incompatible requirements about data sharing under the same conditions.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control game notifications and data sharing separately for each client to protect their privacy and prevent my overload.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to explicitly allow continuous data collection with configurable sharing controls per client to reconcile privacy concerns, while User Story B remains to ensure continuous data collection with full sharing control for enforcing privacy.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want continuous data collection with configurable notifications and sharing controls per client to protect privacy and reduce overload.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual control over data sharing and notifications to respect individual privacy preferences, while User Story B requires continuous collection of all user data for strict privacy enforcement, implying no manual restriction. These impose mutually exclusive conditions on data collection and sharing.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually control notifications and data sharing for each client to ensure their privacy and fit their engagement preferences while managing care effectively.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow manual control over data sharing within user-defined privacy settings, while User Story B is updated to collect data continuously only under explicit consent and with strict privacy safeguards, reconciling manual control and continuous data collection.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to manually control data sharing within user privacy settings, so that client preferences are respected during care management.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect user data under explicit consent, so I can enforce privacy and improve proactive reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual selection of data to record and share respecting privacy preferences, effectively forbidding continuous automatic data collection, while User Story B mandates continuous collection of all user data with full control. These requirements conflict because one forbids continuous data collection, while the other mandates it under all circumstances.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what data to record and share when monitoring multiple clients remotely to fully respect their privacy preferences.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow manual selection of data to record, but permits continuous data collection with explicit user consent, reconciling privacy preferences with continuous monitoring. User Story B remains unchanged enforcing continuous collection with full control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually select data to record and share with explicit user consent, so privacy preferences are respected alongside continuous monitoring.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires respecting client privacy and preferences to keep communications confidential, implying restrictions on data sharing, while User Story B mandates continuous collection of all user data with full control over sharing, potentially conflicting with privacy constraints. This creates a forbid-stop conflict where one mandates operation under certain conditions and the other forbids it under all circumstances.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to leave messages respecting client privacy and preferences, so communications remain confidential.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
resolutionDescription: Clarify privacy and data collection boundaries by updating both stories to respect client preferences while enabling controlled data collection for personalization and reminders.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to leave messages respecting client privacy settings, so communications remain confidential.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to collect user data with consent and control sharing, so I can personalize reminders while respecting privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires sharing user data only with explicit consent to fully protect privacy, while User Story B requires continuous data collection of all user data with full control over sharing to enforce strict privacy. The continuous collection conflicts with the strict consent-based sharing, making these requirements mutually exclusive.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest mild outdoor activities that I can approve and share only with explicit consent, so I can promote wellbeing while fully protecting privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to clarify that data sharing requires explicit consent and only necessary data is collected, allowing continuous data collection under strict privacy controls as described in User Story B.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest mild outdoor activities with user data collected only after explicit consent, so I can promote wellbeing while protecting privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids unauthorized data sharing by strictly mediating communications according to privacy preferences, while User Story B requires continuous collection of all user data with full control over sharing. These impose opposite expectations on data sharing operation triggered by the same system context.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to strictly mediate communications according to privacy preferences, ensuring no unauthorized data sharing.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
resolutionDescription: Apply a context-aware policy layer enabling strict mediation of data sharing based on privacy preferences, while allowing continuous data collection with explicit user consent and control over sharing.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to strictly mediate data sharing according to privacy preferences, ensuring no unauthorized disclosures.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect user data with explicit consent, enabling controlled sharing and fine-tuning of proactive reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires strict control over data sharing to preserve privacy and trust, effectively forbidding broad data sharing, while User Story B requires continuous collection of all user data with control over sharing to enable fine-tuning, which conflicts with forbidding broad data collection or sharing. This is a Forbid-Stop conflict because one forbids broad data sharing under all circumstances whereas the other mandates continuous data collection and sharing control.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want strict control over data sharing, so that client privacy and trust are preserved.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to specify strict control over data sharing with explicit limitations on data collection to preserve privacy, while User Story B remains to focus on continuous data collection with user consent and privacy controls, balancing both privacy and functionality.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want strict control over data sharing and limited data collection, so that client privacy and trust are preserved.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires controlling ALFRED's prompts to respect patient consent and boundaries, implying possible restriction or stopping of prompts, while User Story B demands continuous data collection for enforcing strict privacy and proactive reminders, which may conflict with stopping or limiting prompts under certain conditions.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control ALFRED's prompts when patients ignore them, respecting their consent and boundaries.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to permit continuous data collection only when respecting patient consent, allowing User Story B to remain unchanged emphasizing strict privacy and proactive reminders.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED's prompts to respect patient consent, allowing data collection only with permission to honor boundaries.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual selection to control what health data is logged and shared, implying selective data sharing, while User Story B mandates continuous collection of all user data with full control to enforce privacy, which forbids selective data sharing, creating a conflict on whether all data must be collected or selectively shared.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what health data is logged and shared to fully respect my clients' privacy and autonomy.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story B is updated to allow manual selection of data to be shared while maintaining continuous data collection with strict privacy controls, reconciling continuous collection with selective sharing per caregiver input.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what health data is logged and shared to fully respect clients' privacy and autonomy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data but enable manual control over sharing to enforce strict privacy and fine-tune reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires controlling social features to honor privacy and prevent unwanted interactions, implying restrictions on data sharing, while User Story B mandates continuous collection of all user data with full control over sharing, implying no restriction on continuous data collection. These impose opposite constraints on data sharing and collection, conflicting under the same conditions.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control ALFRED’s social features to honor each client’s privacy and prevent unwanted interactions, so I can support meaningful connections safely.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
resolutionDescription: Adjusted both user stories to clarify that data collection is continuous but sharing is controlled and restricted to honor privacy, resolving the conflict by specifying contexts and controls.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control ALFRED’s social features to restrict data sharing and prevent unwanted interactions, so I can support meaningful connections safely.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect user data with controlled sharing options, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive reminders.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual control to choose which notifications to receive (implying selective notification), while User Story B mandates continuous data collection with full control over sharing to enforce strict privacy and proactive reminders, which may forbid selective notification control by caregivers. This creates a conflict where operation of selective notification is mandated by one story but potentially forbidden or overridden by continuous full data collection and control.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose which ALFRED notifications I receive, so that I can manage my workload and protect my clients' privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow manual notification control within the privacy constraints of continuous data collection mandated by User Story B, ensuring selective notifications are possible without compromising full data control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually select notifications within privacy limits, so I manage workload while respecting data sharing policies.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to continuously collect all user data with full control over sharing, so I can enforce strict privacy and fine-tune proactive voice reminders.
